awd_titl_txt: Conference: Power and Energy Conference at Illinois 2023 (PECI)
awd_abstract_narration:
This travel grant will be used for offsetting the cost of attendees participating at the 14th Annual Power and Energy Conference at Illinois (PECI). Beginning in 2010, PECI is the oldest annual, student-run IEEE international conference about power and energy technology. The conference is organized by the IEEE PES/PELS/IAS Joint Graduate Student Chapter at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and is advised by faculty in the Power and Energy area of the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. PECI has become a perfect place in the Midwest for industry, academic researchers, and students to discuss future power and energy topics such as renewable energy, machines for electric transportation, smart grid reliability, security of cyber physical systems, and power electronics for emerging technologies. The travel funding for PECI 2023 will support underrepresented students such as those from primarily undergraduate or minority institutions. Students who apply for funding will be encouraged to present either a poster or paper and will compete for Best Paper and Best Poster Awards. 

The travel funding for PECI 2023 will help introduce students to innovative power-focused technologies in both the academic and industry sectors, in fields such as machines, power systems, power electronics and entrepreneurship. This will advance the power engineering community by fostering discussion between the leaders of tomorrow and current academic and industry professionals.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Division of Electrical, Communications and Cyber Systems

por.por_cntn:
The 2023 Power and Energy Conference at Illinois (PECI) is an annual conference bringing together experts in the power and energy field. There are keynotes, panel discussions, industry talks, paper sessions, and poster sessions. Topics range from power systems and renewable energy, to machines and power electronics. Each year, the PECI organizational committee seeks NSF aid to help more students participate in the conference. For many students, PECI is the first academic conference they have attended thanks to the received financial assistance. Not only do these students benefit from the invaluable networking, for many it is also their first chance to present their research to others in their field. Here, they can develop their communication skills and engage in valuable discussions about their work. 

 

By attending PECI, students benefit from closer interactions with experts, professors, and industry professionals. It is an opportunity to receive advice and mentorship for their future career. In addition to student technical presentations and posters, students also learn about the mega-trends in power and energy. Cutting-edge research is presented by industry leaders and experts, who deliver keynote presentations and conduct tours of the local utility-scale microgrid and the new ECE building. Moreover, the importance of pursuing a career in power and energy is highlighted by a panel discussion regarding what a career in industry, a national laboratory, academia, or government would entail.

 

Support from NSF for student travel to PECI in 2023, enabled 15 participants from 7 different universities to learn from the conference experience by covering their registration, accommodation expenses and/or travel to and from the conference. 80% of these participants receiving NSF support were women or minorities.


Last Modified: 02/07/2024
Modified by: Kiruba Haran
